import-psc: Before running this script, you should install the PSCompletions module and import it.

invalidName: <@Red>You should enter an available completion name.
compare-json.sameLang: <@Red>The <@Magenta>-TargetLang<@Red> cannot be the same as the <@Magenta>-BaseLang<@Red>.

tip: <@Red>The following are different values or types:

invalidName: <@Red>You should enter an available completion name.
success:
<@Green>Completion <@Magenta>{{ $completion_name }}<@Green> has been created successfully!
You can link the completion via <@Magenta>.\scripts\link-completion.ps1 {{ $completion_name }}<@Green> to preview the completion in real-time while writing it.
If hooks are not needed, please delete the <@Magenta>hooks<@Green> attribute in <@Magenta>config.json<@Green> and hooks.ps1 file, and relink the completion.

invalidName: <@Red>You should enter an available completion name.
link-completion.exist: <@Red>The completion directory already exists, please use <@Magenta>psc rm {{ $completion_name }}<@Red> to remove it first.
linkDone:
<@Green>Completion <@Magenta>{{ $completion_name }}<@Green> has been linked to the PSCompletions module: <@Magenta>{{ $test_dir }}<@Green>

<@Green>Suggestion: Please disable the completion cache via <@Magenta>psc config enable_cache 0<@Green> to preview the latest real-time changes.
<@Yellow>Note: The completion link is only for local use, <@Magenta>psc add<@Yellow> and <@Magenta>psc update<@Yellow> will ignore them.
